intro: Allocarya orthocarpa, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically dark green and leathery, providing year-round cover in its natural habitat. Allocarya orthocarpa is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
